result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Rowland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.



 If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

No contact with business establishment or residence of the former employers.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol or drugs.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recomended by the Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

Restitution to be paid to all the victims, as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard J Rowland in court with attorney Ronald J. Sonderhouse.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 2.  Pauline and Susan J. made brief statements. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 5 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years - 52 days credit, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $278.00 (DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision; alternate 6 days jail - consecutive
- Restitution of $4956.56 to be paid to the victims as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  No contact with business establishment or residence of the former employers. Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs. Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Sentencing hearing on September 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Richard J Rowland in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald J. Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in. Court orders a PSI to be compiled and filed within 30 days. Defendant to remain in the Waukesha County Jail. Court orders bail revoked.  Court will put the matter over for sentencing. Victims request to make a statement at this time. Counsels have no objections. Bernard, Pauline and Susan J. made statements. Defendant made a statement with the victims being present today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
